parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the brake pedal can cause a loss of braking ability, leading to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: The brake pedal goes down to the floor
the brake pedal feels soft or spongy
the brake pedal does not return to its normal position
the vehicle takes longer to stop than usual.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Excessive wear on the rear brakes can cause uneven braking, leading to loss of control or accidents.
symptoms: The rear brake pads wear out excessively
the rear brake rotors show signs of uneven wear
the vehicle pulls to one side when braking.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Tire tread separation can lead to sudden loss of control, accidents, and potentially serious injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: The vehicle shakes or chatters while driving
the tire tread peels off
and the tire blows out.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: An electrical system failure can cause a fire in the vehicle, posing a significant risk to the safety of the occupants and other road users.
symptoms: Smoke smell inside the vehicle
flames in the trunk area.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A faulty ECU can cause a range of problems, including engine stalling, loss of power, and electrical system failures, which can lead to accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: Electrical system malfunctions
engine stalling
loss of power.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: An engine compartment fire can cause significant damage to the vehicle, potentially leading to a loss of control, accident, or injury. In extreme cases, it can spread to the passenger compartment, putting occupants at risk.
symptoms: Smoke or flames visible from the engine compartment
burning smell or odor
engine overheating
loss of engine power
warning lights or alarms on the dashboard.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The intermittent loss of power while traveling at highway speeds can cause the vehicle to slow down or stall, increasing the risk of accidents or leaving the driver stranded.
symptoms: The vehicle loses power or acceleration while driving at high speeds
the engine RPMs may fluctuate
the vehicle may stumble or hesitate
the transmission may slip or hesitate to engage.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the clutch can cause the vehicle to be unable to shift gears, leading to accidents or leaving the driver stranded.
symptoms: The clutch pedal feels soft or spongy
the clutch pedal sticks to the floor
the clutch pedal does not return to its normal position
the clutch pedal has a delayed return to its normal position
the clutch pedal has a sudden loss of pressure
the vehicle is unable to shift into gear.
